thread.title: St Etienne v Manchester United clash produces the weirdest bit of half-and-half merchandise EVER
thread.title_full: St Etienne v Manchester United clash produces the weirdest bit of half-and-half merchandise EVER

author: Mark Jones
title: St Etienne v Manchester United clash produces the weirdest bit of half-and-half merchandise EVER
text:
Yeah, so these are now a thing (Photo: Reuters/@AdeBezzina/Twitter) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
After their team won the first leg of their Europa League clash 3-0 at Old Trafford, some Manchester United fans wouldn't really think that the second leg of their meeting with St Etienne was worth marking in any way. 
But oh how wrong they'd be. 
Because in addition to the usual - and universally hated - half-and-half scarves that are now a staple of every big game these days, there was another bit of merchandise fans could buy before the game in France. 
Yep, half-and-half CLOCKS. 
The very special timepiece - as spotted by Twitter user @AdeBezzina - features United's Zlatan Ibrahimovic - the scorer of a hat-trick in the first leg and a man who has netted 17 times in 14 appearances against the French club before the second meeting - and the St Etienne team. The half-and-half scarf in all its 'glory' (Photo: REUTERS) United fans are out in force in France... (Photo: Getty) ... but not many seem to have bought a clock. (Photo: Getty) 
And in terms of pointless football-related tat it is right up there. 
Anybody fancy one? Is this the worst bit of football merchandise ever? 0+ VOTES SO FAR No, I've seen way worse Like us on Facebook
